events.event_name: Japan S&P Global Services PMI Release (January 2026)
events.description: The release of the revised services purchasing managers' index for Japan in January 2026.

facts.fact_text: Japan’s S&P Global Services PMI rose to 53.7 in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: Japan’s S&P Global Services PMI rose to 53.7 in January 2026, surpassing the flash estimate of 53.4 and December’s 51.6.

facts.fact_text: Input cost inflation in Japan's services sector reached its lowest level in nearly two years.

evidences.evidence_text: input cost inflation eased to its lowest in nearly two years

facts.fact_text: Selling price inflation for Japanese services firms reached a seven-month high.

evidences.evidence_text: selling price inflation climbed to a seven-month high as firms passed on costs.

claims.claim_text: Business confidence in Japan's services sector has weakened to its lowest level since July.
claims.author: S&P Global

evidences.evidence_text: Looking ahead, business confidence weakened to its lowest since July, reflecting concerns over global conditions, softer tourism demand, and persistent labor shortages.

evidence.evidence_text: Growth was fueled by stronger new orders, the quickest in four months, supported by marketing successes, new client wins, and firmer foreign demand.
backlogs accumulated at the sharpest rate since last September, prompting firms to expand capacity through hiring.
input cost inflation eased to its lowest in nearly two years, but selling price inflation climbed to a seven-month high as firms passed on costs.
business confidence weakened to its lowest since July, reflecting concerns over global conditions, softer tourism demand, and persistent labor shortages.
